meanings.definition: relating to the regulation of body temperature
meanings.sent1: The thermoregulatory system helps keep our bodies at the right temperature.
meanings.sent2: She wore a thermoregulatory jacket to stay warm in the cold weather.
meanings.sent3: The penguin's thermoregulatory abilities made it the envy of the other birds.
meanings.sent4: His thermoregulatory instincts were as precise as a well-tuned machine.
meanings.sent5: The thermoregulatory function of the air conditioner was crucial during the heatwave.

meanings.definition: the process of maintaining a stable internal body temperature
meanings.sent1: Proper thermoregulatory is essential for our health.
meanings.sent2: During exercise, our bodies engage in thermoregulatory to prevent overheating.
meanings.sent3: The thermoregulatory dance of the lizard entertained the onlookers.
meanings.sent4: In the animal kingdom, thermoregulatory is a survival skill.
meanings.sent5: The thermoregulatory of the reptile amazed the scientists studying it.

meanings.definition: a system or mechanism that controls body temperature
meanings.sent1: The thermoregulatory in mammals is highly efficient.
meanings.sent2: The malfunction of the thermoregulatory can lead to health issues.
meanings.sent3: The futuristic suit had a built-in thermoregulatory for comfort.
meanings.sent4: The car's thermoregulatory was like having a personal climate control.
meanings.sent5: The thermoregulatory of the house was managed by a smart thermostat.
